paragraphs.content: Psalm 118
paragraphs.contentHtml: Psalm 118

paragraphs.content: O give thanks unto the LORD; for he is good: because his mercy endureth for ever.
paragraphs.contentHtml: O give thanks unto the Lord; for he is good: because his mercy endureth for ever.

paragraphs.content: Let Israel now say, that his mercy endureth for ever.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let Israel now say, that his mercy endureth for ever.

paragraphs.content: Let the house of Aaron now say, that his mercy endureth for ever.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let the house of Aaron now say, that his mercy endureth for ever.

paragraphs.content: Let them now that fear the LORD say, that his mercy endureth for ever.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let them now that fear the Lord say, that his mercy endureth for ever.

paragraphs.content: I called upon the LORD in distress: the LORD answered me, and set me in a large place.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I called upon the Lord in distress: the Lord answered me, and set me in a large place.

paragraphs.content: The LORD is on my side; I will not fear: what can man do unto me?
paragraphs.contentHtml: The Lord is on my side; I will not fear: what can man do unto me?

paragraphs.content: The LORD taketh my part with them that help me: therefore shall I see my desire upon them that hate me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The Lord taketh my part with them that help me: therefore shall I see my desire upon them that hate me.

paragraphs.content: It is better to trust in the LORD than to put confidence in man.
paragraphs.contentHtml: It is better to trust in the Lord than to put confidence in man.

paragraphs.content: It is better to trust in the LORD than to put confidence in princes.
paragraphs.contentHtml: It is better to trust in the Lord than to put confidence in princes.

paragraphs.content: All nations compassed me about: but in the name of the LORD will I destroy them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: All nations compassed me about: but in the name of the Lord will I destroy them.

paragraphs.content: They compassed me about; yea, they compassed me about: but in the name of the LORD I will destroy them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They compassed me about; yea, they compassed me about: but in the name of the Lord I will destroy them.

paragraphs.content: They compassed me about like bees; they are quenched as the fire of thorns: for in the name of the LORD I will destroy them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They compassed me about like bees; they are quenched as the fire of thorns: for in the name of the Lord I will destroy them.

paragraphs.content: Thou hast thrust sore at me that I might fall: but the LORD helped me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou hast thrust sore at me that I might fall: but the Lord helped me.

paragraphs.content: The LORD is my strength and song, and is become my salvation.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The Lord is my strength and song, and is become my salvation.

paragraphs.content: The voice of rejoicing and salvation is in the tabernacles of the righteous: the right hand of the LORD doeth valiantly.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The voice of rejoicing and salvation is in the tabernacles of the righteous: the right hand of the Lord doeth valiantly.

paragraphs.content: The right hand of the LORD is exalted: the right hand of the LORD doeth valiantly.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The right hand of the Lord is exalted: the right hand of the Lord doeth valiantly.

paragraphs.content: I shall not die, but live, and declare the works of the LORD.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I shall not die, but live, and declare the works of the Lord.

paragraphs.content: The LORD hath chastened me sore: but he hath not given me over unto death.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The Lord hath chastened me sore: but he hath not given me over unto death.

paragraphs.content: Open to me the gates of righteousness: I will go into them, and I will praise the LORD:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Open to me the gates of righteousness: I will go into them, and I will praise the Lord:

paragraphs.content: This gate of the LORD, into which the righteous shall enter.
paragraphs.contentHtml: This gate of the Lord, into which the righteous shall enter.

paragraphs.content: I will praise thee: for thou hast heard me, and art become my salvation.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I will praise thee: for thou hast heard me, and art become my salvation.

paragraphs.content: The stone which the builders refused is become the head stone of the corner.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The stone which the builders refused is become the head stone of the corner.

paragraphs.content: This is the LORD’s doing; it is marvellous in our eyes.
paragraphs.contentHtml: This is the Lord’s doing; it is marvellous in our eyes.

paragraphs.content: This is the day which the LORD hath made; we will rejoice and be glad in it.
paragraphs.contentHtml: This is the day which the Lord hath made; we will rejoice and be glad in it.

paragraphs.content: Save now, I beseech thee, O LORD: O LORD, I beseech thee, send now prosperity.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Save now, I beseech thee, O Lord: O Lord, I beseech thee, send now prosperity.

paragraphs.content: Blessed be he that cometh in the name of the LORD: we have blessed you out of the house of the LORD.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Blessed be he that cometh in the name of the Lord: we have blessed you out of the house of the Lord.

paragraphs.content: God is the LORD, which hath shewed us light: bind the sacrifice with cords, even unto the horns of the altar.
paragraphs.contentHtml: God is the Lord, which hath shewed us light: bind the sacrifice with cords, even unto the horns of the altar.

paragraphs.content: Thou art my God, and I will praise thee: thou art my God, I will exalt thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou art my God, and I will praise thee: thou art my God, I will exalt thee.

paragraphs.content: O give thanks unto the LORD; for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever.
paragraphs.contentHtml: O give thanks unto the Lord; for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever.
